newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest bourse approves membership changes.
newsitem.headline: Budapest bourse approves membership changes.

text.p: The Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE) council cleared the way for the membership of Rabo Befektetesi Rt, effective July 8, BSE CEO Jozsef Rotyis told a news conference on Friday.
Rabo Befektetesi Rt is the securities arm of Rabobank Hungaria, which is a unit of Rabobank Nederland.
The bourse council terminated the membership of Talentum Rt, the securities arm of former Magyar Hitel Bank Rt (MHB), effective July 7. MHB was acquired by ABN AMRO Bank in 1996.
ABN AMRO Bank has membership on the stock exchange via its ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett (Budapest) Rt securities arm.
Rotyis said the bourse council will hold an extraordinary meeting next week to discuss several issues, including new membership requests.

He said three other securities houses wish to get membership on the bourse, Hungarian houses Cashline Broker and Diana Rt, and Wood and Company, a brokerage which is member on the Prague Stock Exchange as well.
